intro: Erythroxylum heterophyllum, commonly known as the Peruvian belladonna, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruits are follicles that contain seeds, and the plant is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
